products.title: Canon PowerShot SX130 IS
products.description:
The Canon PowerShot SX130OIS is a compact digital camera with 12.1x optical zoom lens. It is equipped with a 12.1 Mega Pixels CCD sensor, optical image stabiliser, and Canon's Digic 4 image processor. The SX130IS might not be the slimmest compact camera on the market but it differentiates itself from other models with it's 12x optical zoom which can be used during HD video capture which is rare for compact cameras. Like other consumer level Canon digital camers, the SX130 IS offers several "scene" modes which includes miniature effect for movie and fisheye effect for still photos. It has auto focus and face detection functions as well as a 3.0'' TFT colour display. Unlike many cameras the SX130 IS uses AA batteries which contribute to it's large size but it also means that replacement batteries can be easily found. 

Features / Specifications

  • 12.1 Mega picels CCD sensor
  • 12x optical zoom, 4x digital zoom
  • TTL Auto Focus
  • 3.0'' TFT colour display
  • f/3.4 - f/5.6
  • Auto, ISO 80/100/200/400/800/1600 equivalent
  • Built in flash
  • SD / SDHC / SDXC
  • USB2.0, HTSC/PAL
  • Dimensions (W x H x D): 4.46 x 2.88 x 1.80 in. (113.3 x 73.2 x 45.8mm)
  • Weight: Approx. 10.9 oz/308g (including the battery and memory card)

pros.text: Clear instructions and explanations accompany all features, on-screen
Digic IV processor produces very clear images
Manual shooting modes are a plus once you gain experience
Overall, features are pretty extensive for this price range
Impressive zoom range, zoom works well in video mode
12x optical zoom
affordable price point
optical image stabilization (in lens)
uses AA batteries - affordable and easy to find, rechargeable
records video in 720p high definition with stereo audio
solid build quality
records to easy to find, affordable and capacious SD/SDHC/SDXC flash memory cards

cons.text: uses AA batteries rather than more expensive yet higher capacity lithium ion battery packs

related.title: Canon PowerShot SD4500IS
related.description:
The Canon PowerShot SD4500IS is a highend compact camera aimed at the consumer market. It is packed with features such as FullHD (1080p) video recording, slow motion video capture, and a high sensitivity 10.0 mega pixel sensor. With the built in auto program function, the SD4500IS can automatically pick from 28 picture modes to suit the shooting environment thus producing a high quality photo. One particular feature that stands out from the rest is the 19x optical zoom lens which is a rarity in a camera body only 22.3mm thick. The included lithium ion battery last for approximately 150 shots and 4hours 30min of play back time. The SD4500IS is compatible with SD/SDHC/SDXC media cards and can print stored photos via "PictBridge" compatible printers via the provided USB2.0 cable. 

Features / Specifications

  • 10.0 Mega Pixel CMOS sensor
  • 10x optical zoom, 4x digital zoom
  • Auto focus
  • 3.0'' TFT Colour LCD
  • f/3.4 - f/5.6
  • Built in flash
  • Up to  8.8 shots/sec (high speed burst)
  • SD / SDHC / SDXC
  • USB2.0, NTSC/PAL
  • Dimensions (W x H x D): 3.99 x 2.30 x 0.88 in. / 101.3 x 58.5 x 22.3mm
  • Weight: Approx. 6.70 oz. / 190g (camera, including batteries and memory card)

pros.text: built in a compact form factor, small enough to put in a pocket
can take 5 shots in burst mode and automatically pick the best one, or combines them in night mode to bring out the detail
extremely simple operation, easy enough for children
smile detection works very well, consistently releases the shutter at the right time
image stabilization works consistently, even in unsteady hands
improved low light sensitivity (backside illuminated sensor)
10x optical zoom lens
records to easy to find, affordable and capacious SD/SDHC/SDXC flash memory cards
mini-HDMI output for direct playback on compatible HDTVs and displays
capable of recording video in 1080p/24 or 720p/30

cons.text: low light pictures tend to be soft or blurry looking
the zoom lens seems a little too delicate for casual storage in a pocket, need to be careful with it
slow startup time and a fair amount of lag between when the button is pushed and the shutter released
only available in gold and brown
somewhat slow and narrow zoom lens (f3.4-5.6, 36-360mm)
poor battery life - only 150 shots per charge
